## Steps to reproduce

```powershell
choco install less
$env:PAGER='less "-PsPage %db?B of %D:.\. Press h for help or q to quit\.$"'
man new-object
```

## Expected behavior
Help topic displays with now error.

## Actual behavior

```none
PS> man new-object
-PsPage %db?B of %D:.\. Press h for help or q to quit\.$: No such file or directory
```

## Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```none
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.2.0-preview.5
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.2.0-preview.5
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.19043
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: rkeithhill
comments.body: Yes, it appears to be an issue with `PSNativeCommandArgumentPassing`.  If I disable that feature, the issue goes away.

comments.author: 237dmitry
comments.body:
Try to use `$LESS` variable
```
$Env:PAGER = 'less.exe'
$Env:LESS = '-Ds6.3$-Ps Page %db\: Press H for help or Q to quit '
```

comments.author: rkeithhill
comments.body: Thanks but I've already got a workaround.  The real issue here is that this is another instance of `PSNativeCommandArgumentPassing` not quite doing the right thing.

comments.author: 237dmitry
comments.body:
> The real issue here is that this is another instance of `PSNativeCommandArgumentPassing` not quite doing the right thing.

I don't mind.

comments.author: rkeithhill
comments.body:
Or it could be a case of me using an arg parsing "work-around" that is no longer needed.  It works with `PSNativeCommandArgumentPassing` if I remove the double quotes e.g.:
```powershell
$env:PAGER = 'less -PsPage %db?B of %D:.\. Press h for HELP!! or q to quit\.$'
```

comments.author: rkeithhill
comments.body:
There's a wrinkle with removing the double quotes.  If I do that then `git diff` output  no longer works:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5177512/120081860-e4152200-c07c-11eb-87a4-c32d724b1652.png)

comments.author: rkeithhill
comments.body:
OK looking at bash on Linux, it does seem that the quotes are required:
```bash
hillr@Keith-Dell8500:~$ less -PsPage %db?B of %D .bashrc
%db?B: No such file or directory
of: No such file or directory
%D: No such file or directory
```
If you specify the following, `less` works as expected:
```bash
less "-PsPage %db?B of %D" .bashrc
```

title: $env:PAGER not working - regression between 7.1.3 and 7.2.0-preview.5
